column3: Back

We had breakfast, and then went to the beach.
I finished work, and then hit the gym.
She called me, and then started crying.
We got lost, and then found the perfect café.
He apologised, and then everything was fine.

I graduated, after that I travelled for a year.
We ate dinner, after that we watched a film.
She left, after that the party got boring.
I paid the bill, after that we left.
He explained, after that I understood.

I lived in Tokyo. Before that, Osaka.
We went to Paris. Before that, London.
I worked in banking. Before that, teaching.
She was married. Before that, engaged for years.
I was vegetarian. Before that, a total carnivore.
I’ll cook dinner
column5:
meanwhile, he’s playing games.
The kids are sleeping
column7:
meanwhile, I’ll get the car.
It’s downloading

column3:
It’s expensive, at the same time beautiful.
I was laughing and crying at the same time.
She’s shy, at the same time very kind.
Turn left and right at the same time – impossible!
We arrived and left at the same time.

We got lost, later on found the hotel.
It was hard at first, later on much easier.
He was rude, later on apologised.
I hated it, later on loved it.
She was quiet, later on opened up.

We kept trying and eventually succeeded.
After three buses, we eventually got home.
She ignored me, eventually said sorry.
Prices rose, eventually became unaffordable.
He saved money and eventually bought a house.
The kettle’s boiling
column4:
in the meantime, get the cups.
It’s loading
column5:
in the meantime, grab a snack.
Dinner’s cooking
column7:
in the meantime, order drinks.
The film’s starting

column3:
First of all, thank you for coming.
First of all, we need to save money.
First of all, turn off your phones.
First of all, let me explain the rules.
First of all, happy birthday!

To start with, let’s look at the budget.
To start with, I’d like to apologise.
To start with, who wants coffee?
To start with, the weather was awful.
To start with, I was really nervous.

Secondly, we need more time.
Secondly, the cost is too high.
Secondly, nobody agreed.
Secondly, it’s not safe.
Secondly, I’m exhausted.

Next, add the eggs and stir.
Next, we visit the museum.
Next question, please.
Next, turn left at the lights.
Next, I need a holiday!

First clean the room, then relax.
Press enter, then wait.
Call me, then we’ll meet.
Finish this, then dessert.
Save the file, then close it.

After the film, we went for drinks.
After work, I go running.
After lunch, we have a meeting.
After Monday comes Tuesday.
After you – please go first.

Check your bag before leaving.
Think before you speak.
Wash your hands before dinner.
Call me before you decide.
Save everything before shutting down.

While you were out, someone called.
While I cook, you set the table.
While it’s cheap, buy two.
While we wait, let’s chat.
While the sun shines, let’s go!

Call me as soon as you arrive.
I’ll leave as soon as it stops raining.
As soon as I get paid, I’m shopping.
Eat as soon as it’s ready.
Tell me as soon as you know.

Once you try it, you’ll love it.
Once I finish this, I’m free.
Once she starts talking, she never stops.
Once is enough – never again!
Once upon a time…

When I get home, I’m sleeping.
When you’re ready, we’ll go.
When I was your age…
When it rains, it pours.
When hell freezes over!

Wait until I say go.
Don’t open it until Christmas.
I won’t relax until it’s finished.
Stay here until I come back.
We’re open until 10 p.m.

Soon after we arrived, it started raining.
Soon after lunch, I felt sleepy.
Soon after moving in, we painted everything.
Soon after midnight, the party ended.
Soon after saying goodbye, I missed them.

Right after breakfast, we left.
Right after the meeting, call me.
Right after paying, it broke.
Right after summer comes autumn.
Right after “hello” he asked for money.

Ever since Monday, it’s been raining.
Ever since the accident, I drive slowly.
Ever since I met you, I’m happier.
Ever since lockdown, I bake bread.
Ever since then, I check twice.

From then on, I never missed a class.
From then on, we were best friends.
From then on, everything changed.
From then on, I trusted no one.
From then on, I always carry an umbrella.

Up until then, I had no idea.
Up until then, everything was perfect.
Up until then, I loved my job.
Up until then, we were winning.
Up until then, I believed him.

We got married, soon afterwards had kids.
He left, soon afterwards the problems started.
The storm passed, soon afterwards the sun came out.
I sent the email, soon afterwards got a reply.
The film ended, soon afterwards we went home.

In the following years, the city grew rapidly.
In the following years, I travelled a lot.
In the following years, everything changed.
In the following years, we stayed in touch.
In the following years, prices doubled.
